definitions.definition: ( chiefly sports ) Over a great distance in space .
examples: Every golfer wants to hit the ball long and straight.

subdefinitions.definition: Over too great a distance , beyond the target.
examples: She hit her return long and lost the point.

definitions.definition: For a particular duration ( specified by additional qualifying words accompanying it ) .
examples: How long is it until the next bus arrives?
She has known us as long as you.
The meeting has already gone on much too long .

definitions.definition: ( placed before a verb, participle, adjective, preposition, or adverb ) For a long time.
examples: Paris has long been considered one of the most cultured cities in the world.
By eight o’clock, the food will be long gone.
I seldom stay long after class, but yesterday I spent the evening and long into the night.

definitions.definition: ( placed by itself after a positive verb , rare ) For a long time.
A long time ( see usage notes ) .
examples: I haven’t got long to live.
They are in a hurry; they can’t wait for too long .

main_definition: ( chiefly sports ) Over a great distance in space .
secondary_definitions: For a particular duration ( specified by additional qualifying words accompanying it ) .
( placed before a verb, participle, adjective, preposition, or adverb ) For a long time.
( placed by itself after a positive verb , rare ) For a long time.
A long time ( see usage notes ) .

definitions.definition: For a lengthy duration ( see usage notes ) .

main_definition: For a lengthy duration ( see usage notes ) .
